title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હવે ભક્ત હાલારના, વળી કહું કચ્છ સમેત<RHYME_206315>; 
શુદ્ધ મને જે સાંભળે, તેને થાય હરિમાં હેત<RHYME_206315>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The devotee's soul now resides with God, and I will also be united with Him; whoever has a pure heart, will ultimately find shelter in God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
મીઠા બોલા ને મોબતી, હૈયે હેત અપરમપાર<RHYME_206316>; 
પ્રીત પ્રકટ પ્રભુશું, કરું તેનાં નામ ઉચ્ચાર<RHYME_206316>.
gujarati.context: Sweet words bring eternal fame, and I will pronounce the name of my beloved Lord with reverence.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત ગુણવંતા છે ગોંડલે, ભજે પ્રભુ મન નિરમલે; 
પુરપતિ ક્ષત્રી હઠીભાઈ<RHYME_206318>, કરી હરિ ભજીને ભલાઈ<RHYME_206318>.
gujarati.context:
A devotee's heart is pure and free, worshipping God with a noble soul.

Through devotion, one can overcome worldly struggles and achieve spiritual liberation.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત ડોસાભાઈ કહીએ<RHYME_206319>, એહ આદિ બીજા બહુ લહીએ<RHYME_206319>; 
જીવરામ પ્રાગજી સુતાર<RHYME_206320>, ભક્ત જોધો એ જાતિ ઉદાર<RHYME_206320>.
gujarati.context: A devout warrior says: "This is the first seed, and many more will burst forth with great fervor"; a true devotee's soul is pure and generous, like a lotus flower that blooms in its own time.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
વિપ્ર જેઠો મીઠો ને ભાઈજી, ભક્ત શેઠ રૂડો રાઘવજી; 
કડિયા રતનો અજો નારાયણ<RHYME_206322>, હરભમ હરિ પરાયણ<RHYME_206322>.
gujarati.context: A pious brahmin named Raghavji and his brother Vipra are pure in their devotion to Lord Krishna, as if they are the very embodiment of love for God. Their hearts are devoted to Narayan, who is none other than the supreme God Hari.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
વાઘો વાલો કડવો કુંભાર<RHYME_206320>, અર્જણ દેવશી લખો ઉદાર<RHYME_206320>; 
નાથો વાલો લુવાર જેરામ<RHYME_206323>, સઇ ગગો નારાયણ નામ<RHYME_206323>.
gujarati.context: A cruel and merciless person is like a wild beast, devoid of pity or compassion. Only God's name, Naraayan, can bring solace to the miserable soul.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
આંબો કાનો જન જણસાળી, શેખ જીવણ જવન વળી; 
એહ આદિ છે જન અપાર<RHYME_206325>, રહે ગોંડલ ગામ મોઝાર<RHYME_206325>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the abundance of life and vitality in one's home and community, with the phrase "Aado che jan apaar" suggesting an endless supply. It concludes by mentioning the peaceful coexistence and harmony found in a small village called Gondal Gam Mozar.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત ભાટિયો હીરો છે નામ<RHYME_206323>, હરિજન દ્વિજ પ્રજારામ<RHYME_206323>; 
એક વેરાગી તુલસીદાસ<RHYME_206326>, એહ આદિનો મોવૈયે વાસ<RHYME_206326>.
gujarati.context: A devotee's true name is "Hirio", a lowly caste person; his heart blooms like the Tulsi plant, full of divine love.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
નથુજી ઉદોજી જેઠીભાઈ, રૂડા ભક્ત કહીએ ક્ષત્રી માંઇ; 
ભક્ત હરજી ઝીણો કુંભાર<RHYME_206320>, વિપ્ર ગણેશ લાલો ઉદાર<RHYME_206320>.
gujarati.context: A true devotee doesn't crave material wealth, but rather the spiritual prosperity that comes from devotion to God. A selfless devotee like Bhakt Harji is like Lord Ganesh's generous offering of a sacred cow.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ આદિ જે જન કહેવાય<RHYME_206327>, વસે ગામ નાગડકા માંય<RHYME_206327>; 
દેવો ઓઝો કણબી કરમશી, ભજે હરિ વેરીગામ વશી.
gujarati.context: This couplet says that just as the village is established in a fertile land, so too does one establish their devotion to God by being pure and dedicated.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત ડેરિયે માનજી, વડારે વોરો વાલો જનજી; 
કાજુ ભક્ત કાલાવડ માંઇ, ખતરી તે જાદવજીભાઈ.
gujarati.context: A warrior's devotion is to the battlefield, and a wealthy person's pride is in their wealth; both are fleeting and impermanent. Only those who worship God with true devotion achieve eternal joy.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ ઉદાર હેતુ હોંશીલો, જેનો ભાઈ કેશવજી વાલો; 
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત ખિરસરા માંઇ, લાખોજી ને હરિજન બાઈ.
gujarati.context: A very generous and enthusiastic devotee, Kesavji by name; he worships the warrior God in Khirsara temple, considering Lakhooji as his lowly sister.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કણબી શવદાસ રૂપાબાઈ, ક્ષત્રી લાખોજી રહે વડા માંઇ; 
હડમતિયે ભગો વણિક<RHYME_206331>, સુખપુરે દમો ભક્ત એક<RHYME_206331>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a humble and pious individual, Karamasi Shavadasa Roopabai, who is a true devotee of God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત કાયોજી લૈયાળે, વૈશ્ય રતનો જીવો ઇટાળે; 
હરજી વીરજી ભક્ત સુતાર<RHYME_206320>, જન રામજી હીરો કુંભાર<RHYME_206320>.
gujarati.context: A warrior's devotion is like a fleeting moment, while a merchant's life is spent in constant anxiety. A true devotee's soul is tranquil, just as Lord Rama's image remains unmoved amidst the turmoil of the Kumbh Mela.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત કાંથડજી વળી, એહ આદિ રહે વણથળી; 
હરિજન સોની રાઘવજી, લીધા પુંજે ભગવાન ભજી.
gujarati.context: A warrior's devotion is like a tree with deep roots, while a lowly person's devotion is like a tiny mustard seed that still pleases God.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત એક છે લાધો સુતાર<RHYME_206320>, વસે વણથળી મોટી મોઝાર<RHYME_206320>; 
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત રૂડા જગુભાઈ<RHYME_206333>, ઘરે હરિજન નાનીબાઈ<RHYME_206333>.
gujarati.context: A devotee is one who has renounced worldly desires and sleeps with the Lord; a warrior devotee is like a small girl from an outcaste family.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિભક્ત રૂપાળીબા નામ<RHYME_206323>, એહ આદિ ભક્ત મેડીગામ<RHYME_206323>; 
મોડા ગામ માંહિ મોટા ભક્ત<RHYME_206334>, ક્ષત્રી રણમલજી વિરક્ત<RHYME_206334>.
gujarati.context: The devoted soul is named Harirupali Baba, and this is my humble offering; In the village of Moda, there are many great devotees, including Kshatriya Ranmalji Vitarkit.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
દાજી મોનજી ને બાપુભાઈ<RHYME_206335>, ભક્ત ફલજી સુજાંજીબાઈ<RHYME_206335>; 
જલો રાવળ રૂપાળીબાઈ<RHYME_206335>, એહ આદિ ભક્ત મોડા માંઇ.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Daji Monji and Bhakt Falji are devoted to their Lord, just like Ravali and others who have taken initiation in the spiritual path.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત મેઘો નારાયણ નાનજી, મૂલજી વીરજી ને રામજી; 
વસતો લાધો સુતાર લહીએ<RHYME_206319>, હરિભક્ત લાડુબાઈ કહીએ<RHYME_206319>.
gujarati.context: The devotee's heart is filled with love for Lord Rama and Nanaji, as they rejoice in the divine play of fate; their souls merge with the divine, singing praises to Hari.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ફલજી મનુજી હરિજન<RHYME_206337>, ક્ષત્રી કુળે એ ભક્ત પાવન<RHYME_206337>; 
સોની ગોવો અજોભાઈ કહીએ<RHYME_206319>, એહ આદિ છે ભક્ત અલૈયે.
gujarati.context: A devotee is found even among the lowest castes, a true bhakta who has reached God's door; this is the highest wisdom that one can possess.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી ભાઈજી રાઘોજી દાજી, વિપ્ર ભક્ત વાલો જાદવજી; 
લાલ રામ વૈશ્ય હરિજન<RHYME_206337>, વસે શેખપાટમાં પાવન<RHYME_206337>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The Kshatriya brother Raghoji and the Brahmin devotee Jadavji; even the low-caste Ram Vaisyaha and Harijan can take shelter under Shri Krishna's feet.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
કડિયો ભક્ત ઉકો ઓઘો જાણો, જીવો જેરામ ડાયો પ્રમાણો; 
એહ આદિ જે ભક્ત સુંદર<RHYME_206340>, ભજે હરિ રહે નવેનગર<RHYME_206340>.
gujarati.context: A devotee's love is like a lamp that shines brighter with each passing moment; this divine love makes God reside in the city of the soul.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
લાલો કુંભાર અરજણ સઇ, ભજે પ્રભુ જોડિયામાં રઈ; 
ભલા ભક્ત છે ભાદરે ગામ<RHYME_206341>, સુતાર વસતો ભાઈ રામ<RHYME_206341>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a pious person (Lalo) who has found solace in worshipping God, feeling united with Him. This devotee is content and at peace in their village home, surrounded by loving family members.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:

રતનશી ડોસો હરિજન<RHYME_206337>, ગંગાબાઈ લુવાણા પાવન<RHYME_206337>; 
ભક્ત જીવરામ લીલાધર<RHYME_206367>, મૂળજી આદિ જન રાજગર<RHYME_206367>.
gujarati.context: The pious soul, a true devotee of God, is like Ganges water that purifies the heart. Their devotion is pure and unconditional, bringing joy to all.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.couplet:
ધન્ય ધન્ય જેઠી ગંગારામ<RHYME_206341>, ભક્ત શિરોમણી નિષકામ<RHYME_206368>; 
સુત શામજી મૂળજીભાઈ, એહ આદિ જન જેઠી માંઇ<RHYME_206347>.
gujarati.context: Praise is due to Ganga Ram, the devoted devotee who has no worldly desires; he is a true soulmate of Shri Moolji Bhagat.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત એક ડોસાભાઈ<RHYME_206369>, હરિજન બીજા દેવબાઈ<RHYME_206369>; 
ભક્ત રામજી અભુ કલ્યાણ, એહ આદિ જણસાલિ જાણ્ય.
gujarati.context: A warrior's devotion is to the first god, while a low-caste person's devotion is to another god; the devotee of Rama does not know anything else.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં

gujarati.couplet:
એહાદિ જન બીજા અપાર<RHYME_206325>, રહે ભુજનગર મોઝાર<RHYME_206325>; 
સતસંગે રંગે રાતાં રહે, મુખે સ્વામિનારાયણ કહે.
gujarati.context: In this Gujarati couplet, the speaker describes a simple and peaceful life where people live in harmony with each other, enjoying the beauty of nature under the guidance of God. This serene life is characterized by the presence of God's name on one's tongue.

gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:

gujarati.context: Grateful to a virtuous low-caste person, whose merits are immeasurable; they will worship Lord Narayana with utmost devotion and humility.

gujarati.couplet:

શોધ્યે ન મળે એક જે, એવા સતસંગીનો સમોહ<RHYME_206372>.
gujarati.context: A strong bond within oneself is essential, not external desires like anger, greed, or infatuation; one should seek a true companion who shares similar values and understanding.

gujarati.couplet:
સુણી નામ એહ શ્રવણે, જે મનન કરશે મન<RHYME_206337>; 
સકલ કારજ્ય સીજશે, વળી થાશે પરમ પાવન<RHYME_206337>.
gujarati.context: The name "Shravan" will be remembered by the mind, and it will be blessed with all good deeds and divine guidance. Through Shravan, one's soul will be purified and lifted to a higher plane of existence.
gujarati.title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૧૬: હાલારદેશ તથા કચ્છ દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 116: Hālārdesh Tathā Kachchha Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

transliteration.couplet:
Have bhakta Hālārnā, vaḷī kahu Kachchha samet; <RHYME_1>
Shuddha mane je sāmbhaḷe, tene thāy Harimā het.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: A devotee's true nature is revealed only when they are tested in difficult situations. Their pure intentions become clear to the Lord Himself.

transliteration.couplet:
Mīṭhā bolā ne mobatī, haiye het aparampār; <RHYME_2>
Prīt prakaṭ Prabhushu, karu tenā nām uchchār.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: A sweet talker is known for their charm, but it's the heart that truly reveals one's nature. A person's true character is revealed when they are sincere in their words and actions.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta guṇavantā chhe Gonḍale, bhaje Prabhu man niramale; <RHYME_3>
Purapati kṣhatrī Haṭhībhāī, karī Hari bhajīne bhalāī.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: The devotee's virtues shine like a lantern on the mountain peak, and the Lord is pleased with their pure devotion. The king of kings, Hathi Bhai, takes pleasure in worshiping God with utmost sincerity.

transliteration.couplet:
Kṣhatrī bhakta Ḍosābhāī kahīe, eh ādi bījā bahu lahīe; <RHYME_4>
Jīvarām Prāgajī sutār, bhakta Jodho e jāti udār.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context:
The devotee Dosaabhayi is compared to a seed that sprouts and grows; his lineage is as vast as the sky.

Jivaram's son Pragaji is known for his greatness, just like the devotee Jodho from a noble family.

transliteration.couplet:
Vipra Jeṭho Mīṭho ne Bhāījī, bhakta sheṭh rūḍo Rāghavajī; <RHYME_5>
Kaḍiyā Ratano Ajo Nārāyaṇ, harabham Hari parāyaṇ.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: A devotee's faith is like a lotus that blooms in the muck, and Raghuveerji is one such true believer. Narayan is my only refuge, and I am fully devoted to Lord Krishna, my ultimate salvation.

transliteration.couplet:
Vāgho Vālo Kaḍavo kumbhār, Arjaṇ Devashī Lakho udār; <RHYME_6>
Nātho Vālo luvār Jerām, sai Gago Nārāyaṇ nām.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a wise and generous person (Kumbhar) who is loved by the Lord (Arjan Devashi), while a foolish person (Natho Valo) is led astray by their own desires.

transliteration.couplet:
Āmbo Kāno jan Jaṇasāḷī, Shekh jīvaṇ javan vaḷī; <RHYME_7>
Eh ādi chhe jan apār, rahe Gonḍal gām mozār.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: A person's knowledge and wisdom increase with age, but their youthful energy remains. The more one learns, the more they realize how little they know.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Bhāṭiyo Hīro chhe nām, harijan dvij Prajārām; <RHYME_8>
Ek verāgī Tulasīdās, eh ādino Movaiye vās.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: The poet is praising Bhakta Bhartiyo as a hero with a noble name, and his people are like the children of God; Like Tulsi Das, he has spent his life in devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Nathujī Udojī Jeṭhībhāī, rūḍā bhakta kahīe kṣhatrī māi; <RHYME_9>
Bhakta Harajī Zīṇo kumbhār, vipra Gaṇesh Lālo udār.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: A devotee is a true leader and a master, while a craftsman like Haraji is a great potter and Ganesh is generous.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi je jan kahevāy, vase gām Nāgaḍakā māy; <RHYME_10>
Devo Ozo kaṇabī Karamashī, bhaje Hari Verīgām vashī.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a person's spiritual journey, where they should focus on internalizing God's love rather than getting distracted by external worldliness. One should surrender to the divine and engage in devotional practices with selfless attachment.

transliteration.couplet:
Kṣhatrī bhakta Ḍeriye Mānajī, Vaḍāre Voro vālo janajī; <RHYME_11>
Kāju bhakta Kālāvaḍ māi, Khatarī te Jādavajībhāī.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: The summary is: Two devotees, Manaji and Jadavji, are like the lord's own soldiers, standing firm amidst worldly chaos. Similarly, another two devotees, Kala and Mairi, have surrendered to God, leaving their personal desires behind.

transliteration.couplet:
Ati udār hetu hoshīlo, jeno bhāī Keshavajī vālo; <RHYME_12>
Kṣhatrī bhakta Khirasarā māi, Lākhojī ne harijan bāī.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the excessive generosity of Keshavajī, who is so kind that even a lowly caste person like Harijan can benefit from it. It highlights the importance of humility and kindness, showing that one's actions have a ripple effect on those around them.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī Shavadās Rūpābāī, kṣhatrī Lākhojī rahe Vaḍā māi; <RHYME_13>
Haḍamatiye Bhago vaṇik, Sukhpure Damo bhakt ek.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: The summary is: A humble and simple person (Kaṇabī) is more valuable than a wealthy king, and true devotion (Sukhpure) is more important than material wealth.

transliteration.couplet:
Kṣhatrī bhakta Kāyojī Laiyāḷe, vaishya Ratano Jīvo Iṭāḷe; <RHYME_14>
Harajī Vīrajī bhakta sutār, jan Rāmajī Hīro kumbhār.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context:
A king's loyal servant brings prosperity, while a merchant's wise investment yields great returns.

A brave and faithful devotee is blessed with children, just as a skilled craftsman creates beautiful objects.

transliteration.couplet:
Kṣhatrī bhakta Kānthaḍajī vaḷī, eh ādi rahe Vaṇathaḷī; <RHYME_15>
Harijan sonī Rāghavajī, līdhā Punje Bhagwān bhajī.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the devotion of a king's devotee and a Harijan (low-caste) named Raghu, both of whom worship God with equal fervor. Their devotion transcends social barriers, emphasizing the equality of all before God.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta ek chhe Lādho sutār, vase Vaṇathaḷī moṭī mozār; <RHYME_16>
Kṣhatrī bhakta rūḍā Jagubhāī, ghare harijan Nānībāī.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: A devotee is like a foolish little boy, getting entranced in the Lord's love; a king-like devotee is one who worships God with great enthusiasm and fervor.

transliteration.couplet:
Haribhakta Rūpāḷībā nām, eh ādi bhakta Meḍīgām; <RHYME_17>
Moḍā gām māhi moṭā bhakta, kṣhatrī Raṇamalajī virakta.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: The devotee is known by their devotion, just like Meðigām was a devoted one from the start. The one who has renounced worldly desires, like Rañamalajī, is truly a devotee.

transliteration.couplet:
Dājī Monajī ne Bāpubhāī, bhakta Falajī Sujānjībāī; <RHYME_18>
Jalo Rāvaḷ Rūpāḷībāī, eh ādi bhakta Moḍā māi.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The devotee Falajī has obtained the divine love and pleasure; their soul has become immersed in God's ecstasy.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Megho Nārāyaṇ Nānajī, Mūlajī Vīrajī ne Rāmajī; <RHYME_19>
Vasato Lādho sutār lahīe, haribhakta Lāḍubāī kahīe.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

A devotee named Megho Narayana Nanaji, whose roots are in Lord Krishna's divine love; He is a faithful servant who has realized the beauty of devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Falajī Manujī harijan, kṣhatrī kuḷe e bhakta pāvan; <RHYME_20>
Sonī Govo Ajobhāī kahīe, eh ādi chhe bhakta Alaiye.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: A devotee is purified in the presence of a king or a noble, just like a lotus flower blooms in holy water. This same devotee's story is an ancient one, full of devotion and love.

transliteration.couplet:
Kṣhatrī Bhāījī Rāghojī Dājī, vipra bhakta vālo Jādavajī; <RHYME_21>
Lāl Rām vaishya harijan, vase Shekhapāṭmā pāvan.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two individuals: Kshhatrī Bhāījī Rāghojī Dājī, a warrior-saint, and Vipra Bhakta Jādavajī, a Brahmin devotee. Additionally, it mentions Lal Ram, a Vaishya (merchants) and Harijan, who lives in a Shekhapāṭmā pāvan house, which is considered pure.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaḍiyo bhakta Uko Ogho jāṇo, Jīvo Jerām Ḍāyo pramāṇo; <RHYME_22>
Eh ādi je bhakta sundar, bhaje Hari rahe Navenagar.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: A devotee's love is measured by their willingness to take risks, just as a ship's value lies in its journey across the ocean. Beautiful devotees worship Lord Krishna in the city of Nava Nagar.

transliteration.couplet:
Lālo kumbhār Arajaṇ sai, bhaje Prabhu Joḍiyāmā raī; <RHYME_23>
Bhalā bhakta chhe Bhādare gām, sutār vasato bhāī Rām.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a humble devotee, Arajan Sai, who praises the Lord with devotion and song. It also mentions another devotee, Bhakta, who resides in Badri village and is dear to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Vasharām Māvajī Raṇachhoḍ, Nārāyaṇ rājo jan joḍ; <RHYME_24>
Gangādās ne Shavajībhāī, harijan ek Haribāī.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises Lord Narayana as the king who rescues people from troubles. It also mentions a devotee named Gangadasa and his brother Shivaji, both considered to be one with God.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi chhe bhakta sutār, Devo Ḍoso kaṇabī udār; <RHYME_25>
Dvij Mūlajī Sundarjībhāī, kṣhatrī Kānajī ne Nathu nāī.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: A devotee is one who possesses a generous and broad-minded heart, like the mighty Devo Ḍoso mountain range. This couplet honors Dvij Mūlajī Sundarjībhāī and his brother Kānajī Nathu, great leaders of their time.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi je bhakta apār, vase gām Bhādarā mozār; <RHYME_26>
Hīro Ḍungar bhakta sutār, kṣhatrī Ravo Kesiyā mozār.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: A devoted devotee of God is like a river that flows ceaselessly, and a humble seeker is like a simple grain of wheat.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan Premajī vaṇik, Dhroḷ madhye e bhakta chhe ek; <RHYME_27>
Bhakta Nāyo Kānajī udār, Velo Govo Mānḍaṇ kumbhār.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: A devotee (bhakta) is a true gem, rare and precious like a pearl found in the middle of the sea. Such a noble soul, Kānajī, is as valuable as a potter's wheel that creates beautiful vessels.

transliteration.couplet:
Jerām ne ek Rājbāī, Shā Devashī Dhūḷakoṭ māi; <RHYME_28>
Bhakta kaṇabī Lakhamīdās, gar Raṇamal Ghunaḍe vās.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: A courtesan has one king, and the Lord Shiva has a billion ladies; A devotee like Lakhami Das resides in the temple of God's love.

transliteration.couplet:
Āmaraṇyamā Āṇadibāī, jenī prīt ati Prabhu māi; <RHYME_29>
Dvij bhakta Govindajī bhele, bhakta Vajo Borichore bele.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the devotee's love for God as being excessive and overwhelming, just like a mother's love for her child. The devotee's attachment to God is so strong that it cannot be compared to anything else in this world.

transliteration.couplet:
Kṣhatrī bhakta chhe Becharbhāī, Āso Bhāījī Bagathalā māi; <RHYME_30>
Kaṇabī Gaṇesh ne Mānubāī, premībhakta Pipaḷiyā māi.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: A true devotee of the ruler is Becharbhāī, and his love for Bhāījī Bagathalā is unmatched. Similarly, Kanabī Gaṇesh's devotion to Mānubāī is unparalleled, like Pipaḷiyā's love for the divine.

transliteration.couplet:

Lādho Rāmo bharavāḍ joḍya, luvār Raṇamal Chitaroḍya.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: In the village of Vagad, there is a temple where devotees worship five names; Rama's name is dear to me and Ranmal's music is sweet.

transliteration.couplet:

Rāmajī Trikam Vasharām, bhakta luvāṇā Chobāri gām.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: The devotee Thakar Kacharo and Padmasi go to the sacred place of Adhu; Rajaji, the three-faced one, and his beloved Chobari visit the same place.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A devotee is one who has surrendered their ego and intellect to the divine, letting go of worldly attachments. In this state, they are filled with love and devotion, and their soul soars to great heights.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A devotee (Vāgho) has five qualities, and with them, he worships God in a peaceful place. Another devotee (Mūlajī) is like an elephant, strong and powerful, but gentle as a cow.

transliteration.couplet:
Jeṭho Jerām karmaṇ luvār, eh ādi Bhachāu mozār; <RHYME_35>

transliteration.context: A person's karma (actions) is their true identity, and it's what defines them; a devotee of the royal family is considered noble, while one who performs auspicious deeds is truly blessed.

transliteration.couplet:
Rāmasinha Rāyadhaṇ jeh, Jetamāl ādi jan teh; <RHYME_36>
Moṭā bhakta ek Mānabāī, jene prīt ati Prabhu māi.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context:
A devoted believer, Mānabāī, has immense love for God, as seen in her intense longing and yearning.

Her devotion is so strong that she has transcended the worldly bond with Jetamāl and other people.

transliteration.couplet:
Bāī bāījī Karaṇībāī, bhakta ek Megharājbhāī; <RHYME_37>
Ehādi jan kahīe apār, bhakta rahe Dhamaḍakā mozār.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: The devotee is like a rain cloud that pours down blessings, and the Lord is the one who receives them with joy. The devotee's devotion is endless, just like an ocean without shores.

transliteration.couplet:
Haribhakta sutār Vasharām, ehādi jan Dudhaī gām; <RHYME_38>
Vipra bhakta Jeṭho Keshavajī, satasangī sutār Ravajī.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: The devotee Haribhakta is a weaver of Vashram in Dudhi village; and the sage Vipra Bhakta is a musician of Ravaji in Satsang.

transliteration.couplet:

Māvajī Mūḷajī ne Vālajī, Bhāṇīre khokhare Hari bhajī.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: The devotee Thakar Keshavaji lives in Chandranigam and remembers God's name. Maavaji Moolaji has surrendered to Lord Valla ji, dedicating all to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta Kacharo Chhagan, rūḍā Rājabāī harijan; <RHYME_40>
Bhakta Jeṭhī Khīmajī Sanghajī, vase Anjār māi Vālajī.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two devotees, Chhagan and Khīmajī, who are deeply devoted to God and live a simple life with self-control and contentment.

transliteration.couplet:

Dvij Punjo Deveshvar kahīe, sutār Puruṣhottam lahīe.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context:
The devout soul Ukoshā and others have taken refuge in the Lord's village; there, they find solace.

The creator God has revealed himself to Dwij Punjo, and Purushottam has gained understanding through devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi je jan kahevāy, vase gām te Mundarā māy; <RHYME_42>
Kṣhatrī bhakta ek Mankubāī, rahe Kālāghoghā gām māi.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two different individuals: one who is lost in thought and wandering in the Mundarā forest, while another is stuck in a mundane routine in his village.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta sheṭh Ratanajī nām, ehādi jan Jarafare gām; <RHYME_43>
Bhakta sutār chhe Meghobhāī, harijan mātā Meghabāī.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: The devotee Ratanaji is from the village of Jarafare, while his sister-in-law Mehgobi is a devotee and a motherly figure to him.

transliteration.couplet:
Devashī Ṭopaṇādi Khatarī, Hari bhajī gayā bhav tarī; <RHYME_44>
Bhakta luvār chhe Vasharām, sonī Lālo Rāghavajī nām.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: A devotee's soul is like a lotus leaf floating on the divine lake of God's love, untainted by worldly desires. The devotee's heart is filled with the sweet fragrance of devotion to Lord Raghuvirji.

transliteration.couplet:
Shā Sundarajī Chāmpashībhāī, ehādi jan Mānḍavī māi; <RHYME_45>
Mepo thobhaṇ bhakta sutār, Kānubāī ne Jīvo udār.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: The divine beauty Shri Sundarajee is a gentle mother to the soul; She nourishes the devotee's childlike heart with kindness and generosity.

transliteration.couplet:
Kuḷe sahit bhakta pāvan, vase Ḍoṇya gāme harijan; <RHYME_46>
Haribhakta Dāmajī sonār, vase Godharā gām mozār.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: A devotee is purified when accompanied by a saint, just as the village is cleaned by the Ganges River. Similarly, one who has devotion to God is like gold that shines bright in the city of God's love.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij Mūlajī ne Dayārām, ehādi jan Koṭaḍī gām; <RHYME_47>
Bhakta sutār Bhīmajī Ravajī, harijan te harabhamajī.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: The divine soul has taken birth in a poor village, and the devotee's son is being carried by God's blessings to his true home. The lord's mercy has brought him to his destination.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta bāī Jeṭhī Aju nāme, vase te Kāḷā Taḷāv gāme; <RHYME_48>
Ghaṇeṇiye bhakta chhe Ravajī, thayo sutār pār Hari bhajī.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context:
The devotee's name is Jeṭhī Aju, and his abode is in a village called Kāḷā Taḷāv; he is a true devotee of Lord Hari who has surrendered to Him.

This devotee is a great lover of God, having dedicated himself fully to the worship of Lord Hari.

transliteration.couplet:
Netarāmā Shavajī sutār, karyo satasang samajī sār; <RHYME_49>
Nongho Nāgajī bhakta Māvajī, Ḍoso Gopo sutār Sanghajī.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two devotees, Netarāmā and Bhakta Māvajī, who have reached spiritual enlightenment through their devotion to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Premī Premabāī Mānabāī, moṭā bhakta e sutār māi; <RHYME_50>
Sejapāl Sāpat Rāmal, ehādi bhakta Tere aval.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: The beloved is a divine being who has taken the form of my loving mother; I am but a humble devotee surrendered to her mercy. Similarly, just as the lamp's flame burns brightly, my devotion shines forth in your presence.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhaṇasāli Jeṭho Dāmodar, kaṇabī Keshav Kamo Ṭhakar; <RHYME_51>
Eh ādi bhakta bījā kaiye, bhajī Hari rahe gām Dhufiye.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context:
The couplet is about a devotee who has planted the seed of devotion in his heart and will continue to worship Lord Krishna until he reaches the ultimate goal.

It is urging others to do the same, planting the seeds of devotion and staying committed to worshipping God.

transliteration.couplet:
Sheṭh Hansarāj harijan, bhakta Fūlujī jāti yavan; <RHYME_52>
Bhakta Bhaṇasāḷi Hamīr nām, eh ādi bhakta Ruvegām.  <RHYME_52>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Sheṭh Hansarāj and Fūlujī are devotees from lowly backgrounds, while Bhakta Bhaṇasāḷi Hamīr was a noble devotee named Ruvegām.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan bāī Devu nām, vase sutār Vathoṇ gām; <RHYME_53>
Kṣhatrī bhakta Kākobhāī kahīe, eh ādi jan Majale lahīe.  <RHYME_53>
transliteration.context: The couplet refers to Devu, a faithful servant of Lord Harijan (a deity), who lives in the village Vathoṇ and is known for his dedication. The second line mentions Kākobhāī, a devotee of Lord Kṣhatrī, who narrates stories of olden times.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta sutār chhe Punjobhāī, sai Punjo Desalpur māi; <RHYME_54>
Kaṇabī bhakta Lādhā ādi kharā, vase jan gām Sāmatarā.  <RHYME_54>
transliteration.context: A devotee is like a weaver from Punjab, having woven the fabric of his life in his hometown; just as a bee collects nectar from various flowers, he gathers knowledge and wisdom from different places.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij Nāgajī Prāgajī malu, Sāmajī ne Keshavajī bhalu; <RHYME_55>
Nātho Tejashī sutār Shyām, kaṇabī Prem Lakhu Vasharām.  <RHYME_55>
transliteration.context: The phrase compares the greatness of two individuals, Dvij Nagaji and Pragaji, to that of the king of heaven and earth, while Natho Tejashi is compared to a black gemstone precious in its own way.

transliteration.couplet:
Kṣhatrī Adobhāī Kamodās, bhakta moṭā Mānakuve vās; <RHYME_56>
Kaṇabī bhakta chhe Māvajībhāī, eh ādi Nāraṇpur māi.  <RHYME_56>
transliteration.context: The devoted servant is like a guest in the Lord's home, filled with joy and contentment. The true devotee's heart is pure, free from worldly desires.

transliteration.couplet:
Kṛuṣhṇa Ratano kaṇabī kahīe, bahu bhakta Baladhie lahīe; <RHYME_57>
Kṣhatrī Sadābāī harijan, dvij Lālajī Jagajīvan.  <RHYME_57>
transliteration.context: Lord Krishna's devotees are counted by the grain of sand, and many followers are granted eternal life; Kṣhatrī Sadābāī is a Harijan, while Dvij Lālajī is Jagajīvan.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta Vasharām nām, eh ādi jan Kere gām; <RHYME_58>
Kaṇabī harijan Vālabāī, bhaje Hari Meghapur māi.  <RHYME_58>
transliteration.context: A devotee's love for God is pure and true, just like the first rain that quenches a thirsty land. The humble soul worships God in the spiritual city of Meghapur with devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Sārā satasangī Sarali māi, moṭā bhakta chhe Mānajībhāī; <RHYME_59>
Āso Vīrajī Rāmu Ratan, kaṇabī Rāmapure harijan.  <RHYME_59>
transliteration.context: Manaji is a great devotee of Lord Krishna, just like Mānajībhāī; Vīrajī Rāmu and Ratnā are the names of Krishna's beloved ones, in the city of Dwaraka.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaṇabī bhakta chhe Kacharo nām, bhaje Hari rahe Daisare gām; <RHYME_60>
Harajī Kānajī Rām sutār, Ḍoso bhakta Dhiṇoī mozār.  <RHYME_60>
transliteration.context: The devotee is like a small bee that clings to God's name and remains in the village of devotion; similarly, Haraji and Kanaji are true servants of Rama, whose love is as vast as the sky.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta sutār bāī Lakhamī, Punaḍiye Pītāmbar premī; <RHYME_61>
Māvajī Lakhadhīr sutār, Mālabāī Gajoḍ mozār.  <RHYME_61>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

Lakhamī, the devotee's beloved, is filled with love for Lord Krishna, just like the color pītāmbar (yellow).

transliteration.couplet:
Rāmajī ne Kurajī sutār, kṣhatrī Rāsojī bhakta udār; <RHYME_62>
Ek harijan Jījībāī, ehādi jan Bandarā māi.  <RHYME_62>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two people: Ramaji, a noble warrior who is generous in his devotion to Rasoji, and Jijibai, a poor Harijan woman who is struggling to make ends meet, symbolized by the crow's constant demand for food.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhalā bhakta kahīe Bhuj māi, sārā satasangī bāī bhāī; <RHYME_63>
Bhakta nāgar Gaṇapatrām, Harirām Valabhajī nām.  <RHYME_63>
transliteration.context: A devotee is said to be of Bhuj, the supreme lord, and a true friend among friends; he is known as Naragama Ganaptramsa and Hariram Valabhaji.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij Narasaī sut Bhāṇajī, Lakṣhamī doye līdhā Hari bhajī; <RHYME_64>
Harijan chhe Lerakhībāī, prītya navine Prabhujī māi.  <RHYME_64>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes Bhānajī, a devotee of Lord Hari (Krishna), who is freed from worldly desires and loves the divine. The speaker, Lerakhībāī, has a new love, Prabhujī, who is considered as her God.

transliteration.couplet:
Sūryaprabhā Jeṭhī ne Bhavānī, ehādi bhakta brāhmaṇ nānī; <RHYME_65>
Nāgajī sut Hīrajī sutār, Sundarjī sanehī apār.  <RHYME_65>
transliteration.context: The poet compares a devotee's love for God to the sun's warmth, stating that just as the sun melts snow with its rays, similarly devotion melts one's ego. A devotee's love is limitless like the ocean and has no bounds.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhanajī Harajī Jīvarām, Rāghavajī Raṇachhoḍ nām; <RHYME_66>
Kurajī ādi kahīe sutār, Punjī amar premī apār.  <RHYME_66>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two devoted individuals, Dhanaji and Raghuji, who are known for their remarkable love and dedication. Their love is likened to a treasure that cannot be measured or exhausted.

transliteration.couplet:
Seju Jamanā ne Harabāī, moṭā bhakta e sutār māi; <RHYME_67>
Sonīmā satsangī Gomatī, moṭī Mūḷīnī bhalī bhagati.  <RHYME_67>
transliteration.context: The devotee Seju Jamanā has surrendered to God's will; she is a true servant of God. Sonīmā is a seeker of truth and has achieved spiritual devotion through her pure intentions.

transliteration.couplet:
Metā Nathu sut Shivarām, Harajīvan ben Lādhī nām; <RHYME_68>
Mahā mukta dashā e sahunī, bhakta bhojā ādi bahu sonī.  <RHYME_68>
transliteration.context: This couplet praises Shivarām, a devotee of Lord Shiva, and his wife Lādhī, noting their spiritual liberation and selfless service to others.

transliteration.couplet:
Ṭhakar Ukā be Alaiyo kahīe, haribhakta Valabhajī lahīe; <RHYME_69>
Bhagwānajī Manajī bhakta, Rāmadās ne morār mukta.  <RHYME_69>
transliteration.context: The devotee's mind is free from worldly worries when God is remembered, and their spiritual growth is ensured. The devotee's soul is liberated by remembering the Lord, just like Ramadas's was freed from worldly attachment.

transliteration.couplet:
Ratanashī Ḍoso harijan, Gangābāī luvāṇā pāvan; <RHYME_70>
Bhakta Jīvarām Līlādhar, Mūḷajī ādi jan Rājagar.  <RHYME_70>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises Ratan Shah as a devotee of God, with Gangabai being the one who purifies him. Bhakta Jivaram is also celebrated for his devotion to God, being a king among devotees since ancient times.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhanya dhanya Jeṭhī Gangārām, bhakta shiromaṇī niṣhakām; <RHYME_71>
Sut Shāmajī Mūḷajībhāī, eh ādi jan Jeṭhī māi.  <RHYME_71>
transliteration.context: The humble Jethi river is grateful and selfless, with devotees who are pure of heart; the founder Shamoji's brother Moolaji is known for his simplicity.

transliteration.couplet:
Kṣhatrī bhakta ek Ḍosābhāī, harijan bījā Devabāī; <RHYME_72>
Bhakta Rāmajī Abhu Kalyāṇ, eh ādi Jaṇasāli jāṇya.  <RHYME_72>
transliteration.context: A humble devotee is like a seed of God, and a noble person's virtues are compared to a divine tree. A true devotee is like a blessed king, whose good deeds are praised by everyone.

transliteration.couplet:
Ehādi jan bījā apār, rahe Bhujnagar mozār; <RHYME_73>
Satasange range rātā rahe, mukhe Swāminārāyaṇ kahe.  <RHYME_73>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

In Bhujnagar, there's a seed that remains, waiting for its time to sprout; meanwhile, people in Satasang keep chanting Swaminarayan's name at night.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhanya dhanya e harijanne, jenā puṇya taṇo nahi pār; <RHYME_74>
Āṇī het ati uramā, bhaje Nārāyaṇ nar-nār.  <RHYME_74>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises the fortunate ones who haven't sinned and are thus free from karma's burden. They worship Lord Nārāyaṇ with love, their sins erased by devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Ati draḍhāv antarmā, nahi kām krodh lobh moh; <RHYME_75>
Shodhye na maḷe ek je, evā satasangīno samoh.  <RHYME_75>
transliteration.context: The couplet emphasizes the importance of controlling one's inner turmoil, desires, anger, and attachment, as these can lead to chaos within. A true friend is someone who helps you stay calm and composed in the midst of turmoil.

transliteration.couplet:
Suṇī nām eh shravaṇe, je manan karashe man; <RHYME_76>
Sakal kārajya sījashe, vaḷī thāshe param pāvan.  <RHYME_76>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that listening to the name of God is equivalent to contemplating His existence, and it brings joy and peace to one's soul. All worldly desires are left behind, and one's spirit becomes elevated and pure.
